revised_title: Effects of Hemisection of the Spinal Cord on Movement, Sensation, and Reflexes in Cats
tldr: This study investigates the effects of hemisection of the spinal cord in cats on movement, sensation, and reflexes. The results show immediate paralysis below the lesion, followed by gradual recovery. Sensation is always affected on the side of the lesion, with painful sensations felt less on the paralyzed side, and tactile sensations only felt on the non-paralyzed side. Microscopic examination reveals descending and ascending degenerations in the spinal cord.
